title: Quince Jelly
summary: Delicate jelly with the subtle sweetness of fresh quince fruit.

instructions.value: Wash quinces and cut into quarters. No need to peel or core - the skin and seeds add pectin.
Place quince pieces in a large pot with water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 45 minutes until very soft.
Line a colander with cheesecloth and strain the mixture into a bowl. Let drip for several hours or overnight - don't squeeze or the jelly will be cloudy.
Measure the extracted juice. For every cup of juice, add 3/4 cup of sugar.
Pour juice into a pot, add sugar and lemon juice. Stir over medium heat until sugar dissolves.
Bring to a rapid boil and cook for 20-30 minutes until it reaches the jelling point (220°F/105°C).
Test by placing a small amount on a cold plate - it should set and wrinkle when pushed.
Pour into sterilized jars and seal immediately.

tips_and_notes: Quinces turn a beautiful pink color when cooked - this is natural
The longer you cook the fruit, the deeper the pink color
Save the leftover quince pulp to make quince paste
